definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end

sentences.english: A simple compass is helpful for scribing the flowerpot cutouts.
sentences.chinese: 一个简单的指南针，是有助于划线的花盆切口。

sentences.english: The compass was widely used in ancient China for navigational purposes.
sentences.chinese: 指南针在中国古代广泛应用于航海。

sentences.english: Your heart is your best compass.
Does the direction of the compass needle change?
sentences.chinese: 指南针的指针方向会改变吗？

sentences.english: The needle on the compass is pointing directly north.
sentences.chinese: 指南针上的指针正直接对着北方。

sentences.english: I think I would ask for a compass, which always points north, to help find direction.
sentences.chinese: 我认为需要一个指南针，用以辨别方向。

sentences.english: High achievers, however, set their compass and then essentially put it away.
sentences.chinese: 然而，成功人士设置好指南针而实质上把它置于不顾。

sentences.english: An everyday watch can pull double-duty as a compass.
sentences.chinese: 普通的手表可以用作指南针。

sentences.english: First compass was invented and marriages.
sentences.chinese: 指南针首先是风水先生发明和使用的。

sentences.english: Explorers and tourists find their directions with the aids of compass and timekeeper.
sentences.chinese: 有了指南针和时区定位，探险家和游人不再迷路。

sentences.english: It is going to Saraha desert without a guide which is just a compass.
sentences.chinese: 这就如去撒哈拉沙漠而没有向导，少了指南针。

sentences.english: Aligning north-seeking arrow with luminous line and follow front of compass.
sentences.chinese: 对准带夜光显示的寻北针，将指南针置于身前。

sentences.english: Because when you know you're treading uncharted waters, you're following the compass of your heart.
sentences.chinese: 因为你知道你在逆流而上，你在追随你内心的指南针。

sentences.english: A: Qingmuyuan is rich in iron, the compass could not point to the correct direction .
sentences.chinese: 青木源含丰富铁矿，指南针无法指向正确的方向。

sentences.english: Without a compass, it is easy to lose one's bearings in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 在森林中没有指南针是容易迷失方向的。

sentences.english: Minmei: Well the only compass I have ever seen was for drawing circles.
sentences.chinese: 而且，我唯一见过的指南针是在不断转圈的。

definition: a mechanical compass invented by Zu Chongzhi 祖沖之|祖冲之
the world's first seismograph invented by Zhang Heng 张衡 in 132/abbr. for 候風地動儀|候风地动仪

pinyin: quan2 qiu2 ding4 wei4 xi4 tong3
